result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander M. NOVAK was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain full-time employment, schooling or a combination of both.

Obtain high school diploma or its equivalent.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with Michelle Vandegrift and Paula Scheer.

Have no direct contact or any 3rd party contact with any of the victims unless approved by the agent.

Have no contact with any known drug dealers or users.

Write letters of apology to all victims (to be approved by the agent).
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

timeConds.notes: Under the Huber Law, commencing immediately.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-13-15 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Richard Bowe, between 02-01-15 and 02-22-15.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of 2 counts burglary, possess burglarious tools, damage to property and attempted burglary.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 05-04-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and have no contact with Richard Bowe or Heidi Schultz or their residence located at 2500 Beagle Lane, Two Rivers, WI.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
